definition: to get over (a shock, bereavement etc)/to avoid dwelling on unpleasant things/to accept the situation and move on
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Narrator: Froggy want to be a pilot, he want to fly plane.
sentences.chinese: 想當一個飛行員，他想開飛機。

sentences.english: Certainly, sir. Would you like to open a time deposit savings account or a checking account?
sentences.chinese: 好的，先生。您想開定存儲蓄戶頭還是支票戶頭？

sentences.english: Liu Mei discovered when suddenly want to back to chop wood field who drains.
sentences.chinese: 陸梅忽然想開初到砍木場時發現的阿誰下水口。

sentences.english: In many regions, stores can now open or close whenever they want.
sentences.chinese: 現在，許多地區的店鋪都可以想開到幾點就開到幾點。

sentences.english: You want to have a status meeting every day?
sentences.chinese: 你每天都想開一次碰頭會。

sentences.english: I thought he’d get over it.
sentences.chinese: 我還以爲他早已經想開了。

sentences.english: I want to open a checking account. What should I do?
sentences.chinese: 我想開個支票賬戶。我應該怎麼辦理呢？

sentences.english: No problem, sir. What sort of time deposit account would you like to open?
sentences.chinese: 沒問題，先生。您想開哪種定存帳戶呢？

sentences.english: I'd like to open a current account.
I want to open a current account.
I'd like to open a current savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想開個活期儲蓄賬戶。

sentences.english: Just as it is important to be strong and clear, it is essential to be open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 正如堅定清晰很重要一樣，思想開放也同樣必要。

sentences.english: I'd like to have a three year time deposit in the amount of two thousand pounds.
sentences.chinese: 我想開一個兩千英鎊的三年定期存款帳戶。

sentences.english: I have to like to open a current account.
sentences.chinese: 我想開唯一活期存款帳戶。

sentences.english: I would like to open a current account.
sentences.chinese: 我想開一個活期存款帳戶。

sentences.english: Whvia sort of medicine do you take?

definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to give it a try
can't say for sure/maybe
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton
now/at present/at the moment/modern/current/nowadays
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
at that time
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
then/at that time/in those days
